paragraphs.content: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God’s?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God’s?

paragraphs.content: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?

paragraphs.content: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.

paragraphs.content: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.

paragraphs.content: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?

paragraphs.content: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?

paragraphs.content: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.

paragraphs.content: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.

paragraphs.content: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;
paragraphs.contentHtml: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;

paragraphs.content: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?

paragraphs.content: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.

paragraphs.content: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

paragraphs.content: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.

paragraphs.content: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:

paragraphs.content: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
